id: allianceforadvancedhealth--2020-04-14--FDA Releases SHOCKING Warning for Allergy Sufferers

content:

id: allianceforadvancedhealth--2020-04-13--TRICKY Way COVID-19 Could Enter Your Home
title: TRICKY Way COVID-19 Could Enter Your Home
content:
TRICKY Way COVID-19 Could Enter Your Home Each day we learn a little bit more about the new coronavirus .
Now , more than ever , people want to know the proper ways to clean and disinfect .
From wiping down grocery cart handles to door knobs .
Wearing gloves and washing your hands to keep it from spreading .
But there ’ s another way it might be getting into your home…and chances are you haven ’ t thought about it .
I have a question for you : When you come home from the store , when do @ @ @ @ @ @ @ more importantly , where .
The CDC suggests that the likeliness of you getting COVID-19 from it travelling on your shoes is unlikely ( since it ’ s the furthest from your face ) .
But other research shows that the virus can live for hours even days on surfaces .
For example , a study published by the national Institutes of Health showed that the virus can live on cardboard for 24 hours .
And it can survive for two to three days on plastic and stainless steel .
So while shoes @ @ @ @ @ @ @ of transportation for the coronavirus… They are one of your most trafficked articles of clothing .
Now I ’ m not telling you to go and burn all of your shoes if you wore them in public recently .
But if you are in a COVID-19 high risk category , there ’ s no harm in taking extra measures to ensure yours and your family ’ s health .
If you ’ re going out for any reason , when you come home take your shoes off before you go in your house @ @ @ @ @ @ @ spray your shoes with disinfectant .
If you can , leaving them outside is the safest option .
But above all , avoid tracking them through your entire house .

id: allianceforadvancedhealth--2020-04-05--Does Your Blood Type Raise Your COVID-19 Risk?
title: Does Your Blood Type Raise Your COVID-19 Risk?
content:
Does Your Blood Type Raise Your COVID-19 Risk ?
I ’ m sure you ’ re getting tired of hearing about the new coronavirus by now .
But because it ’ s such a huge health concern for our entire world , I feel compelled to make sure you ’ ve got the facts .
Because let ’ s face it , there ’ s a LOT of misinformation out there .
I ’ m sure you ’ re aware that those who are at a higher risk include the elderly , people with underlying health conditions , or a @ @ @ @ @ @ @ might not know is that your blood type can also be a factor in which risk category you ’ re in .
Here are the facts and what you can do if your blood type raises your risk of getting COVID-19 .
Researchers analyzed blood samples from nearly 2,200 COVID-19 patients alongside tens of thousands of healthy persons .
They found that those with A-type blood were at a significantly higher risk of getting the virus .
Whereas those with O blood types had a much lower risk .
The link between coronavirus @ @ @ @ @ @ @ be linked to certain antibodies found in the blood .
This research suggests that people with type A blood may need more aggressive care and treatment if they do get the virus .
The scientists also urge that , if this is your blood type , you should take extra precautions to protect yourself .
Only go out in public if it is absolutely necessary .
Reports show that the virus can live on surfaces from hours to even days — so limiting your external exposure is key .
If you do need @ @ @ @ @ @ @ but be sure to dispose of them and not reuse , as this could carry the virus to other surfaces .
Once you are home remove your shoes and wash your clothes to get rid of any germs that may be travelling on the fabric .
Consider ordering your groceries and other necessities online as this will limit your risk .
You could also have a friend or a family member who is not sick do your shopping for you .
If you do order items online and have them delivered ( including @ @ @ @ @ @ @ with a disinfectant .
Avoid touching your face and be sure to use hand sanitizer or , even better , wash your hands frequently .
Hand washing is still the number one way to slow the spread of this pandemic and fight germs in general .
Lastly , if your blood type puts you in a higher risk category , this is not reason to panic .
By just taking the steps listed above and limiting your time in public will help keep you safe .

id: allianceforadvancedhealth--2020-03-05--Do You Have These HIDDEN Shingles Symptoms?!
title: Do You Have These HIDDEN Shingles Symptoms?!
content:
Do You Have These HIDDEN Shingles Symptoms ?
!
Numbness or shooting pains on one side of your body .
A red rash that creeps over your skin .
And it ’ s often followed by blisters and constant itching .
You probably already know that these are the classic signs of shingles , a miserable viral infection that becomes increasingly dangerous with age .
But what might not know is that there ’ s a different strain of shingles that doesn ’ t have these classic symptoms .
Meaning you could actually have shingles and not even know it @ @ @ @ @ @ @ out .
Research shows that over 33 % of Americans will develop shingles in their lifetime , that ’ s one in every three adults .
But not all of these folks will have your typical run-of-the-mill shingles .
Instead , many will be struck down with a different strand — internal shingles .
Internal shingles is a lot like regular shingles , in terms of how it starts in your body .
But when it comes to symptoms it can be vastly different and even far sneakier .
The iconic red rash @ @ @ @ @ @ @ cases of internal shingles don ’ t have any kind of rash at all .
This kind of shingles is called zoster sine herpete ( ZSH ) and does NOT cause a blistering rash .
Instead , you may have some tingling , maybe chills and muscle aches .
Your lymph nodes may swell , which indicates your body is trying to fight off a virus .
Some may also experience headaches or a fever .
Sounds like a bad cold doesn ’ t it ?
You may be tempted to blow it @ @ @ @ @ @ @ ’ re actually walking around with shingles .
And if left untreated , your situation can go from bad to much , MUCH worse .
It can spread to your internal organs and you could be struck down with pneumonia , brain inflammation and even hepatitis .
All of which are VERY serious and have the potential to be life-threatening .
So how can you protect yourself ?
Even though the virus doesn ’ t spread through sneezing or coughing , it ’ s best to keep your distance from anyone who may @ @ @ @ @ @ @ chance you could still acquire the virus .
Keep yourself healthy .
This means keeping a relatively balanced diet so that your body has enough fuel and nutrients to fight off any invaders .
Taking a vitamin C supplement can also help boost your immune system to give your body an extra layer of defense .
And lastly , if you experience any unusual muscle pains , chills , tingling or any of the other internal shingles symptoms mentioned above , go to your doctor .
It could just be a cold or @ @ @ @ @ @ @ if it is shingles , the sooner you treat it the better off you ’ ll be .
author: Susan White

title: Japanese Superfood FIGHTS Colds and Flu
content:
Your immune system is your body ’ s number one defense against any type of sickness .
And it ’ s especially important this time of year , when cold and flu germs are lurking EVERYWHERE .
But you don ’ t have to wait until you ’ re stuck in bed sick as a dog , to stop these bugs from ruining your winter .
Instead , start by giving your immune system a BOOST and keep yourself from getting sick in the first place .
All it takes is a cup of this Japanese superfood .
Studies have @ @ @ @ @ @ @ your immune system work at its BEST .
Miso is a thick paste , made from uniquely fermented soybeans or another type of bean .
And it ’ s this miso paste that is often used to make sauces and soup stock .
The great thing about this superfood is that it contains countless vitamins and minerals like vitamin K , zinc , B vitamins , copper and manganese .
It ’ s also home to many probiotics that STRENGTHEN your gut flora .
This , in turn , increases your body ’ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ the growth of bad bacteria .
Getting more probiotics in your system can REDUCE your chances of getting sick in the first place .
But more than that , they can also help you recover faster from illnesses like the common cold and other infections .
Try cooking up some miso soup the next time you ’ re in the kitchen .
You can search online for all different kinds of miso soup recipes , or give this easy one a try at Foodal.com .
author: Susan White

title: “Tree Secret” BLASTS Diabetes
content:
Endless finger pricking .
Constantly checking the labels on foods to see how much sugar is in a serving .
Trying to decide what to eat for dinner that won ’ t send your blood sugar through the roof .
This is the reality of living with diabetes… and it ’ s no picnic .
It ’ s not an easy illness to manage by any means , and if you struggle with it , you know just how much it can change your life .
Thankfully , there are ways to get your blood sugar under control that don @ @ @ @ @ @ @ yourself with a needle .
There ’ s an easy way to prevent diabetes and lower your blood sugar naturally , and the secret comes from something found on trees .
A study published in BMJ Open journal found that consuming tree nuts can lead to LOWER blood sugar and triglycerides ( high triglycerides are often a problem with diabetics ) .
They found that the greatest DECLINE in blood sugar and triglycerides was seen in participants who ate an average of 50g of tree nuts ( about a handful or half a @ @ @ @ @ @ @ the group who did not consume nuts .
While nuts are high in calories , research also shows that they actually HELP with weight loss , which is key for anyone trying to beat diabetes .
They ’ re also packed with many minerals and antioxidants that help protect your heart and cells .
And they are a rich source of fiber , which helps keep your gut healthy and lowers your risk of diabetes .
What ’ s more ?
They reduce inflammation , the root cause of diabetes and blood sugar @ @ @ @ @ @ @ for a midday snack , consider grabbing a handful of tree nuts .
Some examples of these are brazil nuts , almonds , hazelnuts , pecans , pine nuts , chestnuts , pistachios and walnuts .
Or you could use them as a salad topping or a great addition to yogurt .
author: Susan White

id: allianceforadvancedhealth--2020-03-01--[Alert] DEADLY Infection Threat Lurking in Your Home!
title: [Alert] DEADLY Infection Threat Lurking in Your Home!
content:
Your home is supposed to be your safe place right ?
You do your best to keep up with updates , home improvements… Sure it might not be tip-top shape…but it ’ s relatively clean .
Right ?
As much as you may strive to keep a clean home , there ’ s one household appliance that SPREADS antibiotic-resistant BACTERIA .
Can you guess which one it is ?
Researchers at the University of Bonn found , in a recent study , that your washing machine is a breeding ground for antibiotic-resistant bacteria .
And from there it can spread… @ @ @ @ @ @ @ .
And then ultimately to you .
The discovery was made at a local children ’ s hospital , where a dangerous pathogen called klebsiella oxytoca , was being passed along to newborns .
After a detailed investigation , they found that pathogen was traveling via the washing machine used to supposedly “ clean ” the babies ’ clothes .
These “ clean clothes ” became a transmitter for this pathogen , allowing it to spread to more and more children .
And if this type of bacteria can spread there , that @ @ @ @ @ @ @ homes .
To help prevent this from occurring , make sure you have a washing machine that reaches a temperature of 140 degrees Fahrenheit .
Your home washing machine washes at a lower temperature because your hot water heater is set to about 120 degrees to save money and to avoid burns .
But if there are young children , elderly adults , or sick folks in your household , it might be time to consider a higher temperature on your water heater .
If you go this route , be sure to @ @ @ @ @ @ @ and showers .
You can also prevent the spread of germs and pathogens by cleaning the washing machine itself .
At least once a week run an empty cycle with a cup of bleach or vinegar .
Also , after washing , keep the door open to allow it to air out .
Also , regularly wipe down the ring around the plastic door with some antibacterial cleaner .
Try some of the above tips to cut back on the germs and ensure your laundry is clean .
author: Susan White

title: [BREAKING] Weight Loss Drug Causing CANCER?!
content:
If you ’ ve been an Advanced Health Daily reader for a while , you already know that mainstream medicine likes to hand out a pill for everything .
And a lot of times these pills do nothing to fix your problems… and are LOADED with side effects .
A common weight-loss drug has now been FLAGGED by – believe it or not – the FDA because it CAUSES cancer .
Recently the U.S. Food and Drug Administration ( FDA ) requested that the producer of the weight loss drug , Belviq ( lorcaserin , PULL the drug from the @ @ @ @ @ @ @ .
And you know this is bad if the FDA is doing something about it… A randomized clinical trial to assess safety shows that folks taking this drug had “ an increased occurrence of cancer.
” The drug manufacturer was required by the FDA to conduct a randomized , double-blind , placebo-controlled trial that involved 12,000 patients over five years .
Originally , the purpose was to assess cardiac problems .
But instead , they found that patients taking lorcaserin were more often diagnosed with cancer than those taking the placebo .
Many @ @ @ @ @ @ @ several types , especially colorectal and pancreatic , occurring more frequently in the group taking lorcaserin .
If you or a loved one are taking this drug you are URGED to stop taking the drug and to dispose of any unused pills .
It ’ s best to dispose of them by dropping them off at one of these drug take-back locations .
You should also talk to your doctor about a drug-free weight loss plan .

title: Breathe Easier with This SWEET Secret
content:
If you live with the shortness of breath… wheezing… and tightness in your chest caused by asthma , you already know how tough daily tasks can be .
Because when it ’ s a challenge for you to do something as basic as breathing , everything can feel impossible .
What ’ s worse ?
Many of the drugs used to “ treat ” asthma are riddled with side effects – like But your ability to breathe shouldn ’ t come at the expense of your health .
Now , it doesn ’ t have to .
And it ’ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ .
In a recent study , published in the Journal of Medicinal Food , an international team of researchers investigated the effects of honey on bronchial asthma – one of the most common forms of this disease .
Researchers pulled data from a total of eight studies .
After analyzing the data and findings , they determined that a particular honey combination therapy was HIGHLY effective in controlling asthma .
Honey combination therapies are treatments where honey and an additional ingredient are used to treat asthma .
The one that was most effective @ @ @ @ @ @ @ cumin seed .
Using this combination therapy , all lung functions were improved in both moderate AND severe asthma cases .
But honey itself is a great help when it comes to your asthma .
Honey helps push mucus out of your airways , which is one of the causes of asthma attacks .
Research suggests the best type of honey to use is dark honey and is available at your local health food store .
Mix it some with tea , or add it as a cereal or granola topping to see @ @ @ @ @ @ @ to pack the double-punch to your asthma , try getting some black cumin ( mentioned above ) in your diet .
You should also be able to find this at a natural foods store or online at Walmart.com

id: allianceforadvancedhealth--2020-03-16--Forbidden Irish Tradition Adds DECADES to Your Life
title: Forbidden Irish Tradition Adds DECADES to Your Life
content:
It ’ s that time of year where just about every restaurant and bar are decked out in green and getting their drink specials lined up for one of the most celebrated holidays in the country… But regardless if you ’ re Irish or not , there ’ s an Emerald Isle ritual that will have you dancing your own little jig .
Because this Irish tradition – one that ’ s forbidden by the mainstream – can nearly DOUBLE your chances of reaching 90 years of age !
If you ’ re not raising a pint of Guinness or @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Because despite what the naysayers from the mainstream say about it , studies show that consuming beer in moderation can strengthen your bones and even help your memory .
And know we know it will have you kissing the Blarney Stone for years to come , too .
Researchers from Maastricht University studied the drinking habits of 5,500 individuals for more than two decades .
They found that men who drink beer daily are 81 % MORE LIKELY to reach age 90 than those who don ’ t .
Even women who drink @ @ @ @ @ @ @ of reaching this milestone by a third !
Even men who consumed 32 ounces are nearly 66 % more likely to live to a ripe old age than those who drank none at all .
It ’ s jam-packed with essential vitamins and minerals .
Like vitamin B6 which helps battle heart disease .
It ’ s also has others like zinc , riboflavin and calcium and even has immune-boosting antioxidants .
All of which give it its elixir effect .
Research even shows that it is great for your brain health too @ @ @ @ @ @ @ this doesn ’ t mean you should start chugging bottles of beer every day .
Too much of any type of alcohol – even beer – can be dangerous for your health .
So that means that you can enjoy roughly 16 ounces , based on the study results , guilt-free and possibly add years… or even decades… to your life .
author: Susan White

title: CORONAVIRUS: 7 Common Myths DEBUNKED
content:
With the recent announcement declaring the new coronavirus , COVID-19 , a pandemic nationwide panic is accelerating and fast .
Their myths and misinformation are spreading like wildfire… and the fear created by these lies have some people doing rather crazy things .
But that ’ s why I ’ m here .
Today , I ’ m going to DEBUNK the top SEVEN common myths about coronavirus .
And I ’ ll tell you exactly how to keep you and your loved ones SAFE during this crisis .
This is NOT TRUE .
The definition of pandemic is a @ @ @ @ @ @ @ illness.
” The problem is many people associate “ pandemic ” with the 1918 flu that killed tens of millions of people .
This sends people into an even greater panic .
It ’ s this kind of hysteria that can lead to empty shelves , low stocks of toilet paper , and a lack of hand sanitizer .
And that ’ s why it ’ s important to keep in mind the true definition .
Myth 2 : Alcohol or chlorine will kill the virus .
Putting pure chlorine or alcohol on @ @ @ @ @ @ @ very dangerous , especially if it gets near your eyes or mouth .
To disinfect surfaces , you can put hydrogen peroxide in a spray bottle or add ½ cup of bleach to a ¾ gallon of water .
But for your skin , handwashing with warm water and soap for 40 seconds is still the best way to prevent the spread of germs .
Even though healthcare professionals use masks to protect against infection , your average disposable mask is NOT effective .
Viral particles are so tiny that they will penetrate @ @ @ @ @ @ @ do not fit your face properly ( most healthcare personnel are individually fitted ) so they will do little to protect you .
Research does suggest that they help prevent you from spreading the disease to others if YOU are sick .
However , they will not keep you from getting the virus .
Myth 4 : It ’ s just like the flu .
It ’ s true that many COVID-19 symptoms look a lot like the flu : fever , cough , aches , respiratory problems .
However , the overall @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Researchers are still working out the mortality rate , but it ’ s likely many times higher than that of the seasonal flu .
Which is why you should take extra care to wipe down surfaces , wash your hands , and practice social distancing whenever possible .
Even though the mortality rate is likely higher than the flu , it doesn ’ t mean that everyone with COVID-19 will die .
The Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention concluded that 80.9 % of the cases were mild .
But that doesn @ @ @ @ @ @ @ altogether .
Being proactive about your health will help keep you and those around you who may be at greater risk , safe and healthy .
Unfortunately , antibiotics only work to fight bacteria , they don ’ t kill viruses .
And currently there is no vaccine for COVID-19 .
To protect yourself , consider taking a vitamin C supplement to give your immune system a boost .
Grapefruit , turmeric , ginger and green tea are also great ways to amp up your immune defense .
Your other best defenses are @ @ @ @ @ @ @ face , and distancing yourself from others , especially if they are sick .
Even if you follow all of the COVID-19 preventative measures , you could still get sick .
It ’ s important that if you show any signs of the virus , coughing , sneezing , chest congestion , shortness of breath or a fever that you seek medical attention .
It ’ s always better to be safe than sorry .
author: Susan White

id: allianceforadvancedhealth--2020-03-19--[BREAKING] Coronavirus: Who is MOST at Risk?
title: [BREAKING] Coronavirus: Who is MOST at Risk?
content:
[ BREAKING ] Coronavirus : Who is MOST at Risk ?
Since the last time we talked about the coronavirus , news surrounding this deadly illness has EXPLODED .
It ’ s now spread from China to countries like France , Australia , Canada…and is even starting to pick up its pace in the US .
I ’ m sure you ’ ve heard about the uptick in US cases and how it ’ s making its way across the entire stretch of our country .
And while no one is safe from this virus , there is one group @ @ @ @ @ @ @ risk .
Friend , if a loved one falls into this category , you ’ ll want to take action now .
Here ’ s what you need to know .
Health officials recently announced that a nursing home outside of Seattle has been the victim of a coronavirus outbreak .
CBS News reported that elderly residents have been quarantined and are being isolated in their rooms and monitored daily .
But research shows that elderly persons are at the highest risk .
With weakened immune systems and pre-existing conditions , they have @ @ @ @ @ @ @ coronavirus outbreak so far .
So what can you do to keep your more vulnerable loved ones safe ?
Start by keeping them away from crowds .
If they need something , even from the grocery store from the pharmacy or grocery store , get it for them or have it delivered from an online store .
The more time they spend in public , my more they are potentially exposed to this dangerous virus .
, it ’ s best to keep them away from highly-trafficked areas where they could come in @ @ @ @ @ @ @ shopping as an alternative .
Wash your hands often .
, Use with soap and water for at least 20 seconds .
If you can ’ t access soap and water , use a hand sanitizer that contains at least 60 % alcohol .
Frequently clean touched surfaces .
Things like railings , counters , doorknobs , handles and remote controls are touched by many and the virus can survive there .
.
If they are sick , contact a doctor right away .
Even the slightest of sniffles could be an indicator @ @ @ @ @ @ @ this instance , it is better to be safe than sorry .
If ANYTHINGanything seems amiss , get in touch with a doctor .
Ask questions .
Especially if your loved one is in an assisted living facility , find out what measures are being taken to ensure cleanliness and protection from the spread of germs .
Stay informed .
Stay up to date on the latest regarding where the coronavirus is .
Has it hit your hometown or a nearby city ?
If so , it may be time to consider taking @ @ @ @ @ @ @ ordering online , and severely limiting outside contact when possible .

title: Mother Nature’s Coronavirus KILLER?
content:
With the coronavirus racing it ’ s way across the country everything is shutting down .
And if your town is still up and running smoothly , chances are it ’ s coming .
Restaurants , bars , movie theaters — any places that draw crowds are closing their doors .
And if you already struggle getting out and about , this can leave you depressed and feeling cut off from the world .
No one likes to feel trapped .
But with the media strongly encouraging social distancing , you may be tempted more than ever to lock yourself @ @ @ @ @ @ @ s something you need to know before you go deadbolting yourself in… And it has to do with Mother Nature ’ s very own COVID-19 KILLER ( hint : you won ’ t find it in your house ) .
While mainstream docs are scrambling to come up with drugs and treatments that get rid of the coronavirus , Mother Nature has already armed us with a powerful weapon : the great outdoors .
[ Text Wrapping Break ] [ Text Wrapping Break ] Now , that may sound basic .
But let @ @ @ @ @ @ @ 1918 flu pandemic : they too practiced isolation , enforced quarantines and shut down social gatherings .
The situation and public response was not all that different from COVID-19 .
There is one BIG thing we need to take away from this historic flu pandemic : the medics treating those severely ill flu patients found that those who were cared for outdoors recovered BETTER than those treated indoors .
The combination of sunlight and fresh air prevented deaths among patients and kept many of the staff from getting infected .
Research shows that @ @ @ @ @ @ @ kills harmful germs .
Sunlight is also a germ killer .
Scientists found that it can even kill the flu virus .
In fact , during the 1918 pandemic , before antibiotics were common , they practiced “ open air therapy.
” Patients were put outside in their beds to breathe fresh outdoor air or they were cared for in a cross-ventilated ward that had open windows 24/7 .
It reduced deaths up to 40 % .
What ’ s more , getting enough sunlight will BOOST your levels of vitamin D. This @ @ @ @ @ @ @ and if your levels are too low , you ’ re at a greater risk for respiratory infections .
So before you get cooped up in your house , consider getting outside daily for some fresh air .
You can still practice social distancing by going on a solo walk around the neighborhood or with a friend or family member that is not sick .
Even just sitting outside on a deck or porch is beneficial for your health .
author: Susan White

title: “Candy Trick” DESTROYS Gum Disease
content:
Keeping your teeth and gums healthy can be a struggle .
Even if you brush and floss daily , you can still find yourself struggling with tooth decay and gum disease .
You might be tempted to think it ’ s not that important in the grand scheme of things .
But really , having good oral health isn ’ t just for looking good when you smile .
Poor oral hygiene has actually been linked to many other health issues… like heart disease , dementia , diabetes… even cancer .
Which is why it ’ s incredibly important to @ @ @ @ @ @ @ But most conventional methods just don ’ t cut it .
Fortunately , there ’ s an easy “ candy trick ” that you can SHEILD from these diseases .
A study published in the journal Anaerobe , found that an extract from licorice can KILL bacteria that can cause plaque buildup and gum disease .
You see , when bacteria build up in your mouth they create a type of biofilm to protect themselves .
To get rid of these bad bacteria , you need to REMOVE this protective layer .
If @ @ @ @ @ @ @ on the path for gum disease or tooth decay .
Well , this sweet root contains two active compounds that help ELIMINATE the enzyme that allows bacteria to create a biofilm .
So then flossing , brushing and mouthwash are MORE effective and better able to get rid of the bacteria .
Just remember that it ’ s licorice root that works .
Not the candy version that ’ s full of bacteria-boosting sugar .
Licorice root toothpaste is available from some online stores .
Or you can pick up licorice root tea @ @ @ @ @ @ @

id: allianceforadvancedhealth--2020-03-23--This Cooking Oil Is CAUSING Dementia and Stroke?!
title: This Cooking Oil Is CAUSING Dementia and Stroke?!
content:
This Cooking Oil Is CAUSING Dementia and Stroke ?
!
I ’ m betting it ’ s sitting in your kitchen pantry right now .
You may cook with it regularly or even use it for salad dressings… In fact , many manufacturers use it in their packaging because it practically never goes bad and will “ up the shelf-life ” of a food product by ten-fold .
But the fact of the matter is , consuming this oil drastically RAISES your chance of dementia… and can even lead to a stroke .
Here ’ s how to avoid it @ @ @ @ @ @ @ journal Scientific Reports , rodents were fed two tablespoons of canola oil per day for 12 months .
They gained a significant amount of weight and more alarmingly started to show signs of dementia and working memory impairment .
At the end , they had formed amyloid plaques – the hallmark of dementia – in their brains .
Even worse ?
The oil had DESTROYED a compound called amyloid beta 1-40 , which protects your brain neurons from damage .
Another recent study , backed by the American Heart Association , published in @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Biology found that eating canola oil can lead to high cholesterol levels and fatty plaque buildup in humans .
These OBSTRUCT the blood flow to your heart — leading to strokes and heart attacks .
It ’ s the mono fats in this oil that increase your risk of having a heart attack or a stroke , due to blood clotting .
Not only that but research shows that nearly 90 % of canola oils are genetically modified to contain a toxic pesticide .
A true recipe for disaster when it comes to @ @ @ @ @ @ @ to cook your next meal , double-check your ingredients .
If canola oil is on your list , consider swapping it out for a healthier alternative .
Oils like olive oil , coconut oil , or sunflower oil , are all options that come loaded with health benefits instead of wrecking your health .
author: Susan White

title: “Banned” Food DOESN’T Cause Heart Disease!
content:
And if you already have a condition like high blood pressure or “ bad ” cholesterol , you ’ re probably well aware of how important it is to do everything you can to keep your heart healthy .
What ’ s frustrating is that for years mainstream medicine has gone back and forth about which foods impact your heart health .
But there ’ s one that was on their “ banned ” list that ’ s PROVEN NOT to cause heart disease… and is even beneficial for your heart !
For years , the mainstream has vilified eggs @ @ @ @ @ @ @ this delicious food will clog your arteries… and put you on the fast track to heart disease .
But that all stops now .
A study conducted by researchers at the Population Health Research Institute of McMaster University gathered data on more than 177,000 people to analyze heart health .
The data included people from over 50 countries .
They found that eating an egg a day DOES NOT increase your risk of developing heart disease .
What ’ s more ?
They concluded that eggs are a good source of many nutrients @ @ @ @ @ @ @ no harmful effect was seen even in those who already HAD heart disease .
Other research shows that choline is an essential nutrient for your health .
Getting too little of it can actually lead to heart disease and other life-threatening conditions .
And one of the best ways we can get choline is from eggs .
This means eating more eggs might even SAVE you from heart disease .
Now that the case on eggs and heart disease has been cracked feel free to enjoy them at breakfast or any other mealtime @ @ @
author: Susan White

id: allianceforadvancedhealth--2020-04-16--[COVID-19]: Is Your Medicine Raising Your Risk?
title: [COVID-19]: Is Your Medicine Raising Your Risk?
content:
[ COVID-19 ] : Is Your Medicine Raising Your Risk ?
We all know the worst thing about COVID-19 is that anyone can get it .
And we ’ re all doing the best we can to stay safe .
But there ’ s something you need to know that I ’ m going to share with you today .
And it ’ s something Big Pharma doesn ’ t want you to know about… i A new study out of the Journal of Travel Medicine , there are certain drugs that could make it even harder to battle COVID-19 @ @ @ @ @ @ @ of these types of drugs , you could be raising your COVID-19 risk .
You might know these blood pressure lowering drugs better by their brand names , like and Atacand or Aceon and Diovan .
And now researchers discovered that these types of drugs might be your worst enemy when it comes to fighting .
As you may already know , many patients who ’ ve lost the battle against COVID-19 have suffered from severe lung infections .
In a study of over 1,099 patients in Wuhan , China—the epicenter of the @ @ @ @ @ @ @ had a worse outcome when it came to fighting COVID-19 .
In particular , patients with high blood pressure suffered the most .
What the researchers think happened is , COVID-19 cells like to bind to the SAME types of enzymes the blood pressure medicine is .
In other words , ARBs work by increasing your ACE2 enzyme to lower your blood pressure .
And COVID-19 loves to bind to these enzymes .
So if they hitch a ride on those enzymes… things could go downhill .
And before you know it , @ @ @ @ @ @ @ lost your strength… and you could be in big trouble .
Here ’ s what you can do .
If you begin to notice COVID-19 symptoms , go to your doctor right away .
Mention this study and ask if there ’ s another medication you can be on instead .
And if you don ’ t want to wait until then , DON ’ T quit your ACE inhibitors or ARBs immediately .
Instead , speak with an integrative doctor who can help you safely wean you off of your medication and @ @ @ @ @ @ @ lowering supplement instead .
In the meantime , strengthen your lungs with an oregano supplement .
Not only can it help you lungs , oregano is a known antiviral as well , so it can help keep viruses at bay .

id: allianceforadvancedhealth--2020-04-18--Pillow Talk: Are Your Sleep Habits DESTROYING Your Brain?!
title: Pillow Talk: Are Your Sleep Habits DESTROYING Your Brain?!
content:
Pillow Talk : Are Your Sleep Habits DESTROYING Your Brain ?
!
With all the stress of COVID-19 and being separated from your loved ones , you might be losing sleep .
And that ’ s perfectly understandable .
After all , everyone has a sleepless night or two .
But when you can ’ t remember the last time you REALLY felt rested , or you find yourself so tired you drift off during the day , you could have a BIG problem .
Because researchers have discovered that = sleep isn ’ t just tied to your mood… @ @ @ @ @ @ @ HAVOC on your brain .
But don ’ t worry .
I ’ m going to tell you EXACTLY what you need to know and how to protect yourself .
If you struggle with getting a good night ’ s sleep , I ’ ve got some urgent news for you : bad sleep ( sleep apnea in particular ) could be AMPLIFYING memory loss .
So it ’ s not just about tossing and turning or feeling tired the next day .
You could be DESTROYING your memories .
= It ’ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ decline .
In a study of 127 healthy older folks , researchers tracked a LOSS of grey matter , greater levels of amyloid plaques , and even problems with metabolism !
Each of these is a chilling sign of advanced cognitive decline… And they ALL happened just from losing sleep .
The study was extremely thorough .
The researchers used SIX types of brain scans to make sure they were getting the right information .
And when they looked at the scans , they noticed something startling .
Not only were the participants @ @ @ @ @ @ @ proteins , they also saw DAMAGE in the posterior cingular cortex .
This is the part of your brain that processes emotion and memory .
But this doesn ’ t have to happen to you .
You can protect yourself , starting with a sleep study .
Now , this doesn ’ t mean a visit to your doctor ’ s germ-ridden office .
Many doctors are offering on-the-phone consultations , and most sleep studies can be done in the safety of your home .
In the meantime , protect yourself by taking @ @ @ @ @ @ @ And to protect your memory , try a brain-boosting dose of fish oil .
You can find each of these online at Amazon .

id: allianceforadvancedhealth--2020-04-19--Try This Sizzling Jungle Secret to REIGNITE Your Love Life
title: Try This Sizzling Jungle Secret to REIGNITE Your Love Life
content:
Try This Sizzling Jungle Secret to REIGNITE Your Love Life Remember how RARE it used to be to get “ alone time ” with your spouse… And how EXCITING it used to be ?
You ’ d drop the kids off at her parents , saying you had to hurry to catch your movie… But really you were rushing back to your house for a long night of passion .
It felt like you barely made it into the house before you were all over each other !
But now , chances are , you ’ re the ones babysitting… @ @ @ @ @ @ @ out since then .
After all , you ’ re both older… And it ’ s normal for things to slow down as you age .
But I ’ m here to tell you it DOESN ’ T have to be that way .
Because my colleague Dr. Allan Spreen has just developed an AMAZING new formula that can STOKE the flames of your love life back to HOTTER levels than ever .
We ’ ve all felt a little lonely and even downright glum with the social quarantine .
But what if @ @ @ @ @ @ @ could be a GIFT ?
Because now you ’ re FREE of those social obligations… so what better time than now to REIGNITE your love life ?
And an exciting new discovery may just be the “ trick ” to do it !

Now , you don ’ t have to BAN yourself @ @ @ @ @ @ @ what is life without a treat every once in a while ? )

content:

Research now shows that lower back pain could be a symptom of cancer .

And though the chances are low , it ’ s important to know what to look for .
First , let ’ s talk about lung cancer .
This is the most common type of cancer , and it effects smokers AND non-smokers alike .
( In fact , 50 percent of lung cancer patients are non-smokers . )
If you start experiencing breathlessness , pain with coughing , or @ @ @ @ @ @ @ time to get to the doctor .
The symptoms for prostate cancer are a little different .
If you ’ re experiencing back pain coupled with pain in your hips , ribs , and spine , you could be at risk .
Spinal cancer is , thankfully , extremely rare , but it ’ s still important to know the signs .
If you notice that your muscles are feeling very weak and you ’ re having trouble walking , it may be time to get a second opinion .
Though you shouldn @ @ @ @ @ @ @ worry , it ’ s always good to be aware of what ’ s happening with your body .
And since pain is a sign of inflammation , which can cause cancer , it ’ s never a bad idea to be proactive .

!

As if feeling miserable and drained from no sleep wasn ’ t bad enough , @ @ @ @ @ @ @ could cause your blood pressure to SKYROCKET .
In a study from the University of Arizona , researchers gathered 300 men and women and asked them to wear a blood pressure cuff when they were awake AND when they went to bed .
These special cuffs took the participants ’ blood pressure every 45 minutes .
The researchers also asked the participants to wear a second device called an actigraphy monitor .
This determined how good of a night ’ s sleep they were actually getting .
This device also monitored their movement @ @ @ @ @ @ @ and turning or staying still .
And the connection was crystal clear… The participants who tossed and turned all night had HIGHER blood pressure than those who had restful sleep .
But not only that—the high blood pressure continued into the next day !
During the following day those restless sleepers had higher systolic blood pressure .
But don ’ t worry—this doesn ’ t have to be you .

Resveratrol helps control blood pressure by @ @ @ @ @ @ @ process that blocks healthy antioxidants .

And they found that their theory was true : the participants with gout had a @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Gout has also been linked in the past to hypertension and obesity , which can both INCREASE your chance of heart failure as well .

title: Hidden Health-Destroyer LURKING in Your Breakfast?!

When researchers surveyed the most popular fruit punch juices , they found that many had pictures of @ @ @ @ @ @ @ only HALF of the juices actually contained the fruit depicted .
Even worse , less than half contained juice from ANY of the fruits on the label .
Even more , many of the juices that claimed they contained “ 100 % juice ” and actually had 2 % or less .

id: allianceforadvancedhealth--2020-05-21--[WARNING] This Danger Is TWICE as Bad as Hip Fractures!
title: [WARNING] This Danger Is TWICE as Bad as Hip Fractures!
content:
[ WARNING ] This Danger Is TWICE as Bad as Hip Fractures !
I ’ m willing to bet you ’ ve been warned many times about the danger of falls and broken hips once you reach a certain age… After all , one bad hip fracture could land you in the hospital… or even the grave .
But while you do your best to be careful , there ’ s you need to watch out for .
It ’ s one you don ’ t hear much about , and it could be TWICE as deadly a fall .
@ @ @ @ @ @ @ lungs… and it can KILL you .
No , I ’ m not talking about coronavirus — I ’ m talking about pneumonia .
And a large-scale French study has shown just how many seniors fail to take it seriously .
Until it ’ s too late .
In a six-year study of over 16,000 seniors , researchers took a look the survival outcomes of those who ’ d been treated for hip fractures and those who ’ d been treated for any type of pneumonia .
And when they looked at the @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Those who ’ d been hospitalized with a hip fracture only had a 5.4 % chance of dying in the hospital .
But those who were treated for pneumonia had a 17.9 % chance of dying .
And it gets worse .
The overall risk for dying within two years of treatment was 80 % higher in those treated for pneumonia .
The important thing to remember is this : if you feel sick , take it seriously .
And know what to look for when it comes to pneumonia .
If you @ @ @ @ @ @ @ chest pain and phlegm or if you ’ re feeling disoriented , call your doctor immediately .
Many doctors are now offering phone or online video appointments and they ’ ll be able to tell you what steps to take if you are dealing with pneumonia..
In the meantime , make sure you ’ re getting both vitamin C and vitamin D to protect your immune system .

id: allianceforadvancedhealth--2020-05-23--“Crystal Ball Method” Could STOP Dementia Before It Starts?!
title: “Crystal Ball Method” Could STOP Dementia Before It Starts?!
content:
“ Crystal Ball Method ” Could STOP Dementia Before It Starts ?
!
Wouldn ’ t it be great to have a crystal ball to see what your golden years will look like ?
You could find out EXACTLY what you need to do to prepare yourself against aging… cancer… diabetes… and more .
Well as they say , “ knowledge is power.
” And part of my goal is to make sure you ’ ve got as much knowledge as possible when it comes to your health .
It ’ s not exactly a crystal ball… but it ’ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ .
And now there ’ s an exciting new study that just might help you “ see into your future ” after all .
It ’ s about one of the biggest problems you face as you age… Because now research has revealed a powerful way to PREVENT dementia… before it even starts .
When it comes to your brain—and healthy aging– you are what you eat .
A new study has found that WHAT you eat has a huge impact on whether or not you get dementia… YEARS before a diagnosis .
@ @ @ @ @ @ @ surprising… It ’ s not the particular foods… it ’ s what you eat together .
You see , the researchers took a look at something they called “ food networks.
” These are the combinations and groups of foods you eat .
They began by looking at the “ food networks ” of 209 participants with dementia and 418 participants without .
They had the participants fill out a food questionnaire , describing their typical diet over the last year .
They asked them to be very specific .
The participants had @ @ @ @ @ @ @ food , from four times a day to only once a month .
Then they had medical checkups every two to three years .
The researchers then followed up five years later and noticed a pattern immediately .
The dementia group relied HEAVILY on processed meats , like sausages .
But it wasn ’ t just those meats that were the problem .
The dementia group was eating them with starchy foods like potatoes and cookies and cakes .
Researchers believe THIS was the actual problem .
Because the non-dementia group ’ s @ @ @ @ @ @ @ a large variety of fresh fruits and vegetables and seafood .
And here ’ s the most shocking part… They could determine who would develop dementia YEARS BEFORE it happened… all based on diet .
The great thing is , you can take advantage of this “ crystal ball ” discovery to prevent dementia .
The lesson here is simple : eat a better variety of foods , and make most of them whole foods like lean protein , fresh fruits and vegetables , and whole grains .
But it also doesn ’ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ ’ s perfectly fine to treat yourself every now and then .
Just make sure your diet doesn ’ t revolve around junk food .
author: Susan White

title: [SHOCKING] New Parkinson’s Trigger Found!
content:
Parkinson ’ s disease is a tragic condition that , frankly , isn ’ t talked about enough .
Over one million Americans live with this sometimes debilitating condition… and 60,000 will be diagnosed each year .
It disproportionately affects seniors… and the consequences are heartbreaking .
Dealing with constant trembling , being unable to write or even TALK … NOBODY wants to live with these symptoms .
But now , there may be a beacon of hope .
Researchers have discovered one way Parkinson ’ s might INFECT the body… And knowing the cause could possibly lower your chances @ @ @ @ @ @ @ In a stunning new breakthrough , researchers have discovered that Parkinson ’ s could start in the gut .
In a special collaboration between the University of North Carolina and the Karolinska Instituet in Sweden , researchers discovered this strange link .
As you may already know , Parkinson ’ s disease is an affliction of the nervous system .
But now , researchers have a clearer idea which nerves Parkinson ’ s preys on : dopaminergic neurons .
These are the types of cells that produce dopamine in your brain… and if @ @ @ @ @ @ @ become depleted .
Dopamine isn ’ t just the chemical known for boosting your mood—it also controls your movement .
But this research focused on a DIFFERENT type of nerve : enteric neurons .
These neurons are found in your gut… and they could be the KEY to unlocking a possible Parkinson ’ s cause .
The researchers gathered material on both human and mouse genes .
Combining all this information allowed them to develop a map of the nerves .
And when they looked more closely at the data , they discovered @ @ @ @ @ @ @ role .
This is backed by a second study from a few years ago , when researchers injected mice with gut bacteria from Parkinson ’ s .
The mice immediately developed symptoms of the disease .
But when they tested healthy human bacteria on the mice , nothing happened .
This gives us a small ray of hope .
If you can support a healthy gut , you could possibly fend off Parkinson ’ s disease .
Start protecting your gut by taking a daily probiotic supplement .
You can find one at @ @ @ @ @ @

id: allianceforadvancedhealth--2020-05-26--[REVEALED] What’s REALLY Causing You to Lose ZZZs
title: [REVEALED] What’s REALLY Causing You to Lose ZZZs
content:
[ REVEALED ] What ’ s REALLY Causing You to Lose ZZZs More than ever , it ’ s important to get a good night ’ s sleep .
Sleep restores your body and protects your immune system , giving you the mental and physical energy you need to stay healthy .
But if you DON ’ T get sleep , everything goes HAYWIRE !
You feel frazzled , tired , but unable to sleep .
And you spend your days feeling just plain FRUSTRATED and miserable .
You may have already heard other reasons why you don ’ t @ @ @ @ @ @ @ in front of electronics , snacking too late at night , or even not getting enough exercise during the day .
But now researchers have uncovered an even BIGGER reason why you may be missing out on precious zzz ’ s… We know that new health discoveries are being made every day… and sometimes they lead to results that can go against previous studies .
And now that ’ s the case when it comes to sleep and weight gain .
Because it turns out that less or poor sleep may not LEAD @ @ @ @ @ @ @ sleep could be CAUSED by weight gain .
You see , if you get poor sleep , your brain cells that communicate with fat cells go CRAZY .
Instead of telling them to burn fat , they forget to relay the message completely… until it ’ s too late .
And as a result , the cells HOLD ON to fat… and suddenly you notice your pants aren ’ t buttoning anymore .
In a new study , researchers used the sleep patterns of worms to test their theory .
The researchers started @ @ @ @ @ @ @ sleep .
And they saw a HUGE drop in ATP , the chemical that helps control how energy is spent or reserved .
This means that sleep could be controlled by HOW and WHEN fat cells are released… meaning if fat is being held on to , your body doesn ’ t know it ’ s time to sleep .
But when the researchers played with a different gene , the one that processes fat , the worms began to sleep again .
Sleep and weight are a chicken-and-egg problem , but the @ @ @ @ @ @ @ is better for your body across the board .
Try intermittent fasting to help regulate your weight .
This popular way of eating involves eating during a six to eight-hour window during the day , like 12-6 or 11-7 .
You can pick any time you like , as long as you just stick to eating during that time .
author: Susan White

title: [COVID-19] Is This Your Body’s “Germ Gateway”?
content:
[ COVID-19 ] Is This Your Body ’ s “ Germ Gateway ” ?
When it comes to the coronavirus , you can never be too careful .
This includes keeping up with every development and tip that comes out .
And now there ’ s another new element to the coronavirus story .
It ’ s a new theory about how the virus might enter your body .
It ’ s a strange “ germ gateway ” that could be opening the door for COVID-19 .
Here ’ s what you need to know .
You probably remember reading @ @ @ @ @ @ @ symptom where you suddenly lose your sense of smell .
Well , now researchers have discovered that your nose might have another role when it comes to the virus .
It could be the entry point .
You see , your nose has many types of cells , but there are two specific types that the coronavirus hones in on : goblet and ciliated .
Goblet and ciliated cells have special proteins called ACE-2 inhibitors and TMPRSS2 that the coronavirus grabs onto .
The theory goes that coronavirus acts like Velcro , hanging @ @ @ @ @ @ @ researchers gathered tissue from the lungs , kidneys , nose , eyes , gut , liver , and heart to see which cells were the most vulnerable to coronavirus .
They found that other areas of the body contain ACE-2 inhibitor and TMPRSS2 proteins , including the gut and the eyes .
The eyes could be a problem as well , as we often touch our eyes many times throughout the day and could transfer germs from our hands to our tear ducts .
But the nose is an even a bigger problem @ @ @ @ @ @ @ making it a gateway for germs .
This discovery is a reminder why it ’ s so important to stick to the recommended methods of dealing with the pandemic .
Wash your hands frequently and sanitize them every time you touch something in public .
Wear a mask when you go out , and limit going out as much as possible .
Also make sure to use antiseptic spray or wipes to clean high-touch surfaces in your home , such as door knobs , faucets , and TV remotes .

id: allianceforadvancedhealth--2020-05-28--“MD Secret” Improves Eyesight AND Prevents Dementia!
title: “MD Secret” Improves Eyesight AND Prevents Dementia!
content:
When it comes to Alzheimer ’ s disease , there ’ s no magic potion .
And even if there were , Big Pharma would package it and sell it to you for your weight in gold .
So , right now , since there ’ s no cure – we need to focus on our best option : prevention .
Luckily there ’ s a NEW way to protect your brain , keep your memories AND your independence .
It comes from a study conducted by the National Eye Institute… and the results are astonishing .
You ’ ve @ @ @ @ @ @ @ ’ s known for its miraculous effects on your heart and blood pressure… and it ’ s especially beneficial if you want to shed a few pounds .
But now they ’ ve found it ’ s even MORE powerful than they originally thought .
Two new studies from the National Eye Institute show that the Mediterranean diet can improve cognitive function , as well as eyesight .
Now I know what you ’ re thinking… what does an EYE study have to do with my brain ?
Part of the goal of @ @ @ @ @ @ @ part of the Mediterranean diet affected the body in general , so the researchers could see if any particular vitamin was more powerful than another .
But then researchers honed in on a second goal : find out which part of the diet could prevent or slow dementia .
They conducted two simultaneous studies : the Age-Related Eye Disease Study ( AREDS ) and AREDS2 .
Each group tested over 4,000 seniors .
The first study had two groups of participants who either had age-related macular degeneration or didn ’ t .
The @ @ @ @ @ @ @ degeneration .
The researchers tested the participants ’ cognition at two , four , and ten years for AREDS2 , and at five years for the main study .
Those who stuck closely to the Mediterranean diet had a MUCH lower loss of cognitive function .
And the researchers discovered something else : the more vegetables and seafood the participants ate , the better the results .
But the best performing group , by far , was the group that ate the most seafood .
Even better , one part of the group @ @ @ @ @ @ @ s STILL saw the effects !
The Mediterranean diet is fairly easy to stick to , just eat plenty of fish , fresh vegetables , whole grains , and a dash of olive oil .

They took baseline tests of the women ’ s vision , and then measured again four years later .
And they found something SHOCKING .
Of the women who had 20/40 or worse vision , 8.2 % developed dementia by the end of the study , @ @ @ @ @ @ @ women with normal vision .
The connection was stunningly clear : bad vision and dementia go hand-in-hand .
There are a few takeaways : If you suffer from poor vision , you can ’ t change your eyesight completely .
But one thing you CAN do is start taking a lutein supplement to help stop the progression .
Lutein was shown to stop and even reverse eye aging in a largescale study of veterans .

@ @ @ @ @ @ @ electronics like your phone or computer and has been shown in multiple studies to deteriorate eyesight .

title: [COVID-19] Promising Formula Discovered?
content:

You were born with this part of your immune system but it weakens as you age .
You see , your immune system has two parts : the innate and the adaptive .
The innate part is what you ’ re born with , and it deteriorates as you age .
It ’ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ viruses and bacteria , which is why many people tend to get sicker more often as they get older .
The adaptive part of your immune system is what you normally think of when you hear about the immune system : it ’ s formed by being exposed to different viruses and creates specific immunities over time .
It builds defenses based on each kind of disease it encounters .
In this new study , researchers used a special concoction of curcumin , vitamin C , and glycyrrhizic acid to see if it @ @ @ @ @ @ @ They tested this combo at a cellular level , against infected coronavirus cells .
And the results were encouraging… Curcumin , vitamin C , and glycyrrhizic acid not only helped stimulate immune system cells , it also keep dangerous inflammation levels low .
Inflammation is the key cause of many diseases , and what can make them so strong .
Follow the researchers ’ example and start with 500mg of vitamin C a day , as well as 4mg of curcumin .

content:

But these people aren ’ t arctic explorers—so what exactly is happening ?

And it seems that , so far , it ’ s just affecting young people , specifically young adults and children , but since what we know about coronavirus is always changing , it ’ s worth taking note .
If you notice your feet look red , swollen , or feel tender , call your doctor @ @ @ @ @ @ @ saying , that if you develop a dry cough , fever , or lose your sense of smell , it ’ s worth calling your doctor as well .

id: allianceforadvancedhealth--2020-06-06--[COVID-19] Could This  “Natural Secret” Make a Difference?
title: [COVID-19] Could This  “Natural Secret” Make a Difference?
content:

It turns out , one of our best bets for fighting the coronavirus is something that ’ s already in nature… You ’ ve heard plenty already about vitamin D for protecting your immune system… but now there ’ s even @ @ @ @ @ @ @ University surveyed data from hospitals all across the world , they found that a vitamin D deficiency appeared more frequently in citizens of countries with higher mortality rates .
One of the theories as to why vitamin D and coronavirus deaths may be linked is something called cytokine storms .
Basically , a cytokine storm is inflammation that ’ s gotten out of control .
Cytokines are part of your body ’ s immune system , and when too many get released into your blood stream , inflammation happens .
And one of @ @ @ @ @ @ @ often attack the lungs and respiratory system , this could be why some coronavirus patients don ’ t survive .
The researchers made sure to emphasize that vitamin D may not be right for everyone , and there are many other factors controlling coronavirus survival rates .
But in the meantime , it ’ s worth upping your levels .
And thankfully , it ’ s easy .
To raise your vitamin D intake , simply get outside in the sunshine .
This doesn ’ t mean you have to go to a @ @ @ @ @ @ @ can get enough vitamin D simply by sitting on your porch .
It takes just 20 minutes a day to get the amount you need .
And if you want to go the extra mile , start eating more eggs and fatty fish .
Both are high in vitamin D .

content:

Not surprisingly , there WAS a connection… and for those who weren ’ t getting enough flavonoids , the results were grim .
These participants were putting themselves at a two to four times higher risk for dementia , and almost as much for Alzheimer ’ s disease .
But those who ate roughly 7.5 cups of berries a month , eight apples or pears , and 19 cups of tea had the lowest instances of Alzheimer ’ @ @ @ @ @ @ @ like a lot , but it ’ s really quite easy to add these fruits and tea to your diet .

title: [COVID-19] Big Pharma’s Latest “Treatment”
content:
Leave it to Big Pharma to take advantage of consumers whenever possible .
Now they ’ re making a trial run of one of their drugs… on COVID-19 patients .
But here ’ s the kicker : this particular drug is one that many doctors have ordered coronavirus patients to stop because it interacts with traditional treatments .
Now Big Pharma is saying this drug can help coronavirus patients… and as usual , there ’ s more to the story .
What is the drug that Big Pharma is hoping will work ?
This class of drug is called a @ @ @ @ @ @ @ short—and is often used by diabetes patients to help lower glucose and protect their kidneys from too much glucose absorption .
When it ’ s given to diabetes patients who have coronavirus , it can cause a condition called diabetic ketoacidosis .
This is when glucose can no longer enter your cells due to low insulin levels .
It can even make your blood acidic .
And a lot of the symptoms of diabetic ketoacidosis can sometimes look like the coronavirus symptoms themselves , including coughing , fever , chills , and chest @ @ @ @ @ @ @ decisions about treatment , it ’ s worth knowing some of the facts .
First , it ’ s important to look at who is sponsoring the trial .
At first glance , it seems alright : the research is being conducted at Saint Luke ’ s Mid-America Heart Institute is conducting the study .
But then the truth comes out : AstraZeneca is footing the bill .
And they just so happen to be the manufacturers of Farxiga , a brand of dapaglifozin .
To make matters even more complicated , some @ @ @ @ @ @ @ treatment .
The doctor leading the study , Dr. Mikhail N. Kosiborod , says that it can help protect patients who have risk for heart issues .
But it seems that there are more doctors against the treatment than for it .
Only time will tell if this line of treatment is effective or not .
The trial will run for thirty days .
Though the treatment has not yet become mainstream , it ’ s worth noting both the pros and cons of this controversial treatment .
You can keep up-to-date as @ @ @ @ @ @ @ on clinicaltrials.gov .
In the meantime , remember that there is not , as of yet , a “ magic bullet ” cure for coronavirus .
And it ’ s always worth pulling back the curtain to see what ’ s going on in studies that sound a little too sunny .

title: AVOID Strokes with This “Mind Trick”
content:
Surviving a stroke can mean a few things… First , you ’ re thankful you ’ re still here !

I know that may sound too good to be true , but let ’ s look at the facts : Researchers gathered data from the DESERVE study — an ongoing study designed to learn more about cardiovascular health .
And when they took a closer look , they discovered that 552 stroke patients who believed it wouldn ’ t happen again STAYED healthy .
That ’ s right—simply by believing they would stay healthy , they DID @ @ @ @ @ @ @ over matter at play ?
Perhaps .
But here ’ s what ’ s really happening when you look at the glass half full instead of empty… Patients had their blood pressure measured ( for both groups ) at the beginning and end of the year-long study .
And they found that the positive-thinking group specifically had LOWER systolic blood pressure , effectively SLASHING their second stroke risk .
So how can you get these results for yourself ?
Well when it comes to retraining your brain to think more positively , it @ @ @ @ @ @ @ .
You can start by creating a gratefulness journal .
Before you go to bed , write down three things that you ’ re thankful for or three positive things that happened that day .
Before you know it , you ’ ll be focusing on the positive things that happen to you throughout the day rather than the negative .

Bilberry has been show in multiple trials to help prevent blood clots because they ’ re full of vitamin K .

title: Brazilian Germ-Killer WOWS Scientists
content:

and it could be the key to STOPPING dangerous infections .
A new study has shown that the red pepper tree could prevent MRSA , one of the largest antibiotic-resistant bugs out there , and the cause of 119,000 staph infections each year .
The latest study was a follow-up to a previous promising study @ @ @ @ @ @ @ , researchers found that this concoction could reverse harmful skin lesions on mice by “ blocking ” the bacteria ’ s signals .
Blocking the bacteria ’ s signals is so important because then the bacteria can ’ t send out dangerous toxins throughout the blood stream .
In this study , however , the researchers had used 27 compounds of the plant , so it was impossible to see which part of this formula was fighting back against infection .
In the new study , the researchers cracked the code .
After @ @ @ @ @ @ @ against the bacteria , the researchers discovered that triterpenoid acids , a special chemical found in certain plants and animals , are the secret behind this antibacterial powerhouse .
When the researchers tested triterpenoid acids against skin lesions on mice , the acids halted the damage in its tracks .
It ’ s proof that , once again , that NATURE has the best answers .
You can find Brazilian red pepper tree extract online .
You can mix this tincture in your tea or take it by itself to help strengthen your @ @ @ @ @

id: allianceforadvancedhealth--2020-06-21--FILL UP on Carbs AND Stay Healthy!? (Wow!)
title: FILL UP on Carbs AND Stay Healthy!? (Wow!)
content:
FILL UP on Carbs AND Stay Healthy !
?
( Wow ! )
It seems like every few years some food becomes the DEVIL .
And you ’ re told to avoid it at all costs if you want to stay healthy .
For a long time , it was fat… but now they ’ ve made carbs the culprit .
Everywhere you turn you see “ low-carb options ” and “ low-carb menus.
” But carbs may not be the bad guy… In an exciting new study , researchers have discovered that adding one simple thing to your meals @ @ @ @ @ @ @ even erase the “ bad effects ” of carbs .
Researchers have now discovered that a simple spice blend could be all it takes to make carbs healthy again .
Your spice cabinet could ALSO be your medicine cabinet !
In a randomized , controlled study , the researchers gathered a group of 12 men between the ages of 40 and 65 who were overweight or obese .
Next , the researchers gave the participants three meals over the course of three days , one unseasoned , one with a small amount of @ @ @ @ @ @ @ amount of spices .
The meals were both high in fat AND carbs .
The seasoning blend consisted of : Finally , the researchers measured the levels of inflammation in the participants ’ blood , before and after the meals .
And they found something astounding… After eating the spiced meals , the inflammation levels plummeted !
The researchers measured the inflammation by looking at something called cytokines .
These inflammatory cells indicate how bad the inflammation has gotten out of control .
And when they measured the levels after the test , @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Chronic inflammation affects 125 million Americans , and it ’ s the source of multiple diseases , including rheumatoid arthritis , diabetes , and COPD , not to mention obesity .
To get the benefits of the study , aim for one teaspoon to one tablespoon of the combination of the above herbs .
You can find organic versions of all the spices used in the study at your local grocery store or on Amazon .

author: Susan White

title: Brand NEW Test for Alzheimer’s?!
content:
Being tested for Alzheimer ’ s disease can be a harrowing experience .
Not only are you already full of worry over your frequently-occurring memory lapses , you ’ re subjected to expensive MRIs and CT scans that you ’ re not sure you can afford… And worse , your doctor may even need to do a painful spinal fluid test to get a definitive diagnosis .
It ’ s HIGH time these tests were improved… and now they finally might be .
Researchers have discovered a new way that could be just as accurate and MUCH less invasive .
@ @ @ @ @ @ @ country .
In a startling breakthrough , researchers have discovered a better way to test for Alzheimer ’ s disease that isn ’ t as difficult as traditional tests .
And best of all , it could be just as effective .
In a new Swedish study , researchers found a biomarker called p-tau217 ( a type of plasma ) that indicates Alzheimer ’ s disease .
A biomarker is an established threshold that doctors can refer to in order to spot disease .
And this one could be the best new discovery @ @ @ @ @ @ @ .
The researchers found that this blood biomarker is only elevated when Alzheimer ’ s disease is present , unlike previous blood biomarkers that could indicate Alzheimer ’ s or another disease .
They examined three different groups of patients with Alzheimer ’ s , some with only mild cognitive impairment , and some with healthy brains to see what biomarkers they had in common .
This is when they discovered the presence of p-tau217 .
Those who had Alzheimer ’ s had this type of plasma in their blood , while those @ @ @ @ @ @ @ It ’ s a remarkable advance… and it couldn ’ t come soon enough .
While this test isn ’ t yet widely available , stay tuned .
It will soon hopefully become the most common way to test for Alzheimer ’ s disease .
In the meantime , protect your brain with Rhodiola rosea .
This ancient herb has been proven in recent studies to help reduce tiredness and promote clear thinking .
You can find Rhodiola rosea at your local health foods store or pharmacy .
author: Susan White

id: allianceforadvancedhealth--2020-08-13--[COVID-19] This Group Could Be the Most Affected
title: [COVID-19] This Group Could Be the Most Affected
content:
[ COVID-19 ] This Group Could Be the Most Affected I think I can safely say that we all wish the coronavirus would just go away .
It ’ s been going on for over five months now , and it ’ s had us riding a crazy wave of hope and despair .
One moment it looks like the pandemic is finally ebbing… and then a tidal wave of cases crashes down on us again .
Thankfully , we have medical researchers who are working hard every day to make discoveries .
And in a recent study , they @ @ @ @ @ @ @ yet .
They ’ ve found that the coronavirus could be more present in yet another group of people .
And it might surprise you to find out who it is .
Unfortunately , it still may not be safe to see the .
Researchers have just discovered that children could carry MORE coronavirus germs than adults .
In fact , they could carry up to 100 times more , specifically in their nose .
In the study , researchers took a closer look at test swabs gathered from four different testing sites @ @ @ @ @ @ @ into three groups : children under 5 , children 5-17 , and adults 18 and over .
And they found that the first group had the greatest concentration of the virus .
The jury is still out on whether this means children can transfer the virus more quickly than—or even just as much as—adults .
It isn ’ t too much of a leap of the imagination , however , to imagine children spreading the virus .
After all , how many times did you have to beg your own children to wash @ @ @ @ @ @ @ ?
In other words , it may be best to play it safe for now .
Keep in touch instead with email or phone calls , and install a free video messaging system like Zoom on your computer if you ’ re more tech-savvy .
author: Susan White

title: [BREAKING] The Flu Shot Does WHAT?!
content:
[ BREAKING ] The Flu Shot Does WHAT ?
!
It ’ s almost that time of year : flu season .
And when we ’ re already battling coronavirus , it ’ s natural to want to protect yourself any way you can… including getting a flu shot .
It also doesn ’ t help that there are WILD claims about what else it could do for your health .
Claims that will have you racing to your local CVS tomorrow to get the needle .
But before you do , read this .
Because like many things , @ @ @ @ @ @ @ be true .
In two new studies , researchers looked at whether or not getting a flu shot could lower your odds of getting Alzheimer ’ s disease .
Sure it sounds great at first—who doesn ’ t want to lower their odds of getting Alzheimer ’ s ?
But the problem is , getting the vaccine only lowers your risk 17 percent .
And if you keep getting regular flu shots , your risk drops an additional 13 percent .
It might sound worth it… after all you might think anything is @ @ @ @ @ @ @ what about the risks ?
For one , we all know the flu vaccine is a shot in the dark—pardon the pun—at best .
Last year alone , the flu shot was only 37 to 50 percent effective ( depending on the type of flu ) .
And since it takes around two weeks to become effective , many people STILL end up with the flu anyways !
But you could also face a number of severe allergic reactions that could land you in a hospital bed .
The flu shot even puts @ @ @ @ @ @ @ Guillain-Barré syndrome , which is a terrifying condition that can leave you paralyzed .
It ’ s important to weigh your options carefully and look at the situation from all sides .
But if you have a compromised immune system , talk to your doctor before you skip out on the shot .
If you don ’ t , however , it might be worth considering to sit it out .
In the meantime , protect your brain with a proven supplement like curcumin .
Curcumin calms the inflammation that can cause Alzheimer @ @ @ @ @ @ @ 500mg a day .
Make sure you get a supplement that also contains black pepper to help your body better absorb curcumin ’ s benefits .
• According to a Feb. 21 CDC Morbidity and Mortality Weekly Report , the current influenza vaccine has been 45 % effective overall against 2019-2020 seasonal influenza A and B viruses .
• Specifically , the flu vaccine has been 50 % effective against influenza B/Victoria viruses and 37 % effective against influenza A ( H1N1 ) pdm09 .
author: Susan White

title: Veggie Diet’s Dark Secret REVEALED
content:
As long as there are people on this planet , there will be fad diets .
Whether it ’ s South Beach or Weight Watchers , whether you leave out carbs or leave out fat , there are thousands of “ experts ” out there who will tell you why THEIR way is the best way .
And no one is quicker to state their opinion than vegans and vegetarians .
But before you throw out the ground chuck and stock up on black bean burgers , there ’ s something you should know .
These meat-free diets are NOT @ @ @ @ @ @ @ be… especially for seniors .
In a new study out of the UK has discovered something shocking… something the plant-minded WON ’ T want to hear… Veggie protein is not as good as meat for seniors .
Yes , an excuse to eat meat !
When researchers compared both wheat and soy meat substitutes with traditional meat , they found that the fake meat simply couldn ’ t build muscle like regular meat , especially for aging muscles .
In fact , they found that meat FAR outperformed the plant-based proteins .
The @ @ @ @ @ @ @ non-meat products and then measured their muscle loss .
As you know , you lose muscle as you age , so it ’ s that much more important to ensure you get enough protein .
But in all honesty , it ’ s no surprise that meat replacements aren ’ t as healthy as they seem .
All you have to do is check the nutrition label to find this out .
Many veggie products are highly processed and often contain more sodium than the meat they ’ re replacing !
While it @ @ @ @ @ @ @ all-or-nothing diet , it ’ s best to use moderation and avoid the obvious bad guys like saturated fats and processed foods when you can .
Stick to getting healthy portions of all food groups , and balance out your meat and veggies .
